com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.plugins.localization

Class MapLocale

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.plugins.localization.MapLocale

  • public final class MapLocale
extends Object
    A MapLocale object builds off of the Locale object and provides additional geographical information particular to the Mapbox Maps SDK. Like Locale, MapLocale can be used to make the map locale sensitive.

    The MapLocale object can be used to acquire the matching Locale's map language; useful for translating the map language into one of the supported ones found in MapLocale.Languages.

    You'll also be able to get bounding box information for that same country so the map's starting position target can adjust itself over the device's Locale country.

    A handful of MapLocale's are already constructed and offered through this class as static variables. If a country is missing and you'd like to add it, you can use one of the MapLocale constructors to build a valid map locale. Once this is done, you need to add it to the Locale cache using addMapLocale(Locale, MapLocale) where the first parameter is the Locale object which matches up with your newly created MapLocale.

    Since:
    0.1.0

public com.mapbox.mapboxsdk.geometry.LatLngBounds getCountryBounds()
        Returns a LatLngBounds which represents the viewport bounds which allow for the entire viewing of a country within the devices viewport.
        Returns:
        a LatLngBounds which can be used when user locations unknown but locale is
        Since:

      • addMapLocale

        public static void addMapLocale(@NonNull
                                Locale locale,
                                @NonNull
                                MapLocale mapLocale)
        When creating a new MapLocale, you'll need to associate a Locale so that Locale.getDefault() will find the correct corresponding MapLocale.
        Parameters:
        locale - a valid Locale instance shares a 1 to 1 relationship with the MapLocale
        mapLocale - the MapLocale which shares a 1 to 1 relationship with the Locale
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • getMapLocale

        @Nullable
public static MapLocale getMapLocale(@NonNull
                                               Locale locale)
        Passing in a Locale, you are able to receive the MapLocale object which it is currently paired with. If this returns null, there was no matching MapLocale to go along with the passed in Locale. If you expected a non-null result, you should make sure you used addMapLocale(Locale, MapLocale) before making this call.
        Parameters:
        locale - the locale which you'd like to receive its matching MapLocale if one exists
        Returns:
        the matching MapLocale if one exists, otherwise null
        Since:
        0.1.0
